url.description: The full URL of this request

eTLDplus1.description: The eTLD+1 for this request. For example, if the tracker `https://google.com/a.js` was loaded in the page `https://example.com`, then the eTLD+1 for this request would be `google.com`

pageUrl.description: The full page URL where this request was observed

entityName.description: The **display name** of the entity this request belongs to, for example: `Amazon.com`, or `Google`. **NOT** `Google LLC` <- that would be the `ownerName`

category.description: The category to display for this request. For example, 'Advertising'. Note: the Tracker Radar may assign multiple categories, but we would only show one of them. Please refer to existing implementations to see the order in which you should choose.

prevalence.description: The prevalence of the associated entity - if one is known. For example, `10.2` or `82.8`

ownerName.description: The name of the company this requests belongs to, if one is known. For example `Google LLC`

state-blocked.title: StateBlocked
state-blocked.description: When present, indicates that this request was blocked

state-allowed.title: StateAllowed
state-allowed.description: When present, indicates that this request was allowed to load. The `reason` key should indicate why it was allowed

reason.description: The reason a tracker was not blocked

protectionDisabled.title: ProtectionsDisabledReason
protectionDisabled.description: This indicates that the request was allowed because either the user or DuckDuckGo disabled protections

ownedByFirstParty.title: OwnedByFirstPartyReason
ownedByFirstParty.description: This indicates that the request was allowed because the request was to a domain that the current web page's owner also owns

ruleException.title: RuleExceptionReason
ruleException.description: This indicates that the request was allowed because of a rule exception, such as a Tracker Radar 'ignore' entry

adClickAttribution.title: AdClickAttributionReason
adClickAttribution.description: This indicates that the request was allowed because of Ad Attribution

otherThirdPartyRequest.title: OtherThirdPartyRequestReason
otherThirdPartyRequest.description: This indicates that the request was allowed because it was to a third party, but was not classified to be a tracker
